abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objectives of the
            Financial Sector Adjustment Credit Project are to: 1) allow
            increased production and capacity utilization through the
            provision of foreign exchange resources to finance imports
            of inputs, raw materials, spare parts and services; 2)
            create a competitive, sound and efficient banking system; 3)
            improve public confidence in financial institutions; 4)
            foster a health adjustment and renewed growth in the
            financial sector, which will contribute to the
            government's stabilization objectives; 5) encourage the
            development of sound contractual savings organizations; and
            6) develop technical capacity in banking and financial
            management and reinforce the implementation of the
            country's reform program as a whole.  The components of
            the projects are the following: 1) creation of a policy and
            regulatory environment conducive to the sound growth of a
            competitive and efficient private banking system; 2)
            liquidation of the two dominant and insolvent state-owned
            banks: Agroprombank and Elbank; 3) downsizing and financial
            restructuring through private re-capitalization of two large
            and insolvent former state banks: Promstroi and AKB
            Kyrgyzstan Banks; 4) creation of a temporary Debt Resolution
            Agency to help collect, restructure, sell or write-off the
            old non-performing loans, and thus accelerate enterprise
            restructuring or liquidation in the process; and 5) creation
            of a regulatory and supervisory framework, and supporting
            policies and infrastructure, for the development and growth
            of emerging non-bank financial institutions.
